descript.abstract:
Electoral district boundary polygons for Germany as they existed 1890-1912.
Boundary data digitized from the source map: "Konfessionsstruktur der Wahlkreise, 1890-1912" [Map 10] in Jurgen Schmadeke's Wahlerbewegung im Wilhelminischen Deutschland : die Reichstagwahlen von 1890-1912, Volume 2. (c)1995 Akedemie-Verlag. All rights reserved.
Map data digitized here with permission.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production.

cntperp.cntorg: Harvard University - Center for European Studies

idinfo.datacred:
Source data: "Konfessionsstruktur der Wahlkreise, 1890-1912" [Map 10] in Jurgen Schmadeke's Wahlerbewegung im Wilhelminischen Deutschland : die Reichstagwahlen von 1890-1912, Volume 2. (c)1995 Akedemie-Verlag. All rights reserved.
Map data digitized here with permission.

citeinfo.title: Wahlerbewegung im Wilhelminischen Deutschland : die Reichstagwahlen von 1890-1912
citeinfo.othercit: Bd 2. Wahlergebnisse und Strukturen im Kartenbild. [Map 10] : "Konfessionsstruktur der Wahlkreise, 1890-1912"

srcinfo.srccontr: Source map from which boundaries were digitized

procstep.procdesc:
A paper copy of the source map listed above was scanned into .jpg format.
The scanned image was processed in Adobe Photoshop to extract just the electoral boundary vectors, and this was saved to a new .jpg image: Electoral_Boundaries.jpg
Electoral_Boundaries.jpg was added to ArcMap version 9.2, and georeferenced into the Europe Equidistant Conic coordinate system using a total of 10 control points picked from a combination of the World Countries 2006 (ESRI Data and Maps 9.2) polygon vector layer, and ESRI World Imagery raster basemap.
Once georeferenced, the electoral Electoral_Boundaries.jpg raster was reclassified to isolate just the electoral boundaries as one value. The ArcGIS "Thin" tool was applied to the Electoral_Boundaries.jpg, reducing the number of cells representing the width of the boundaries. The result from this was converted to polylines. Topology was built for the polyline layer, identifying undershoots and overshoots in the dataset. All topologic errors were fixed, and the polylines were converted to a polygon layer: German1895electoraldistricts.
A field of type Short Integer was added to the German1895electoraldistricts layer, named "district_n". This fields represents the constituency number in each electoral district. The correct district_n values were entered for all of the polygons. A field of type Text was added to the German1895electoraldistricts layer, named "district". The district name for each electoral district was entered into this field. Note - not all polygons have district numbers or names, since some of them are islands without districts assigned.
Source map and constituency polygon numbering performed by the research team of Daniel Ziblatt, Harvard University, Center for European Studies, 27 Kirkland St., Cambridge, MA, 02138. dziblatt@fas.harvard.edu
Source map georeferencing, topology editing, and line to polygon conversion performed by Jeff Blossom, Center for Geographic Analysis, Harvard University, 1737 Cambridge St., Cambridge, MA, 02138.

cntperp.cntorg: Center for Geographic Analysis, Harvard University
